snippet: The United States is suffering the consequences of leaning on a model that often limits tennis to those who can afford it. The solution would be using the public school system to widen the talent pool.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column explores why the United States has a difficult time producing tennis champions; suggests that public schools make tennis part of the curriculum.
lead_paragraph: The United States is suffering the consequences of leaning on a model that often limits tennis to those who can afford it. The solution would be using the public school system to widen the talent pool.

headline.seo: To Excel in Tennis, United States Should Look to High Schools
headline.main: With Help of Schools, Trickle of Talent Could Become a Flood
headline.print_headline: With Help of Schools, Trickle of Talent Could Become a Flood
